Comments_List: I learned about all kinds of questions and ideas in machine learning beyond the standard "is the algorithm accurate?" For example, we discussed fairness/bias/discrimination, robustness, stability, generalization, physics-inspired optimization, and more.
Overview of some topics in theoretical machine learning; the necessity of understanding assumptions in machine learning models
A better theoretical and applied understanding of theoretical topics in machine learning.
This class delves into the principles and proofs motivating modern machine learning methods.
I wish this course was a year-long course or longer!

Having an assignment or two in the initial portion of the class would have been helpful for us to refresh background knowledge. Pointers to resources were given, but I feel that making these required would help. Also, I would have like to see the full syllabus from the beginning and to know the direction where the course was headed, as it was uncertain at points. Having regular meetings with the professor was very helpful.
I liked that each module was separate so we were able to get a good understanding of various topics. I wished there was more feedback and perhaps collaboration in the project component of the class.
The course covers a diverse array of topics while preserving technical depth. I don't have any criticism.
Absolutely. The best course I've taken here, maybe the best course I've taken period.
If you are interested in working on a project in this area and getting more insight into the topics, then I would recommend.
I would recommend this course to students interested in mathematically motivating machine learning algorithms.
